column4: I have a question about processor usage.  I just switched from windows 2003  where my processors ran about 5% peak but my memory usage was 1.5 gig normally.  here is a screenshot of my Ubuntu 8.04 currently online http://www.kwtfstudio.com/1/Screenshot-System%20Monitor.png  the website is www.kwtfstudio.com    any way to get the processor usage down ?
only running a LAMP
if nobody can answer here then try #ubuntu-server and #linux..
ok, let me do a screenshot of processes
well,  I never ran linux till 3 days ago
I got lost with the server edition
ok cool,   is it normal to swap from one processor to the other back and forth?  looks like it is,  wish windows did that
ok,  well this is my first shot with Linux,  Ubuntu is the answer
tj83 -  ok,  Im still a noob lol
my only 2 issues right now on my AMD64  is drivers for Nivdia 9800gt not working right and flash for firefox
Netsurf, I was wondering about 32 bit firefox.  its not really a huge deal because I dont use this box for anything but a server
but the video issue kills me,  screen resolution is horrible
did you install the nvidia driver supplied by ubuntu? from the hardware driver menu?
scuinzi, nividia 9800gt on a amd64  isnt supported.  its a install at your own risk deal
in Linux
you can use the 64 bit driver supplied by nvidia..
http://www.nvidia.com/object/linux_display_amd64_185.18.14.html  .. there is a trick to installing it though.
how would I install that, I actually have that on my desktop
the first thing is to deactivate the current running nvidia driver from hardware drivers.. then open synaptic and uninstall the nvidia bits listed that are installed..
ok
after all that http://pastebin.com/f44f9d82b
thanks I will try that tonight when everyone is sleeping  lol
you'll have to remember that by installing the driver you'll have to go through the reinstall process for each kernel upgrade..
also if  you use "Update" to go from one release to the next you'll want to uninstall it first.
